lab.description: Find here some upcoming contents. To take a part in their creation, click on them: you will be redirected to our Slack, the place to be of the co-creation pool!

noCardsLeftMessage.title: There is no more question for now.
noCardsLeftMessage.text:
âœ¨  Subscribe to the premium offer to turn off geolocation and match with questions from around the world  âœ¨

Just kidding.
But seriously, maybe you should turn off your geolocation if you want to save battery. That said, you do what you want with your phone. And it's convenient to have a GPS, anyway. I remember this time I had to go visit my aunt LÃ©onie in the Perche, and... Anyway.

Do you have a question that you no longer dare to ask, because you're supposed to already know the answer?

Share it!

safeSpace.title: Let's smash the impostor syndrome together.
safeSpace.description:
As a junior developer, you're suffering from the impostor syndrome?

At Electronic Tales, we believe it doesn't have to be that way.

why.title: Why ?
why.body:
Thanks to the explosion of short training courses, more and more developers come from different backgrounds, and it is so much better.

However, once in business, these people sometimes feel that a "glass wall" separates them from their colleagues coming from more traditional routes. A wall built on cultural or technical references that they do not have  ğŸ–– ğŸ¥š ğŸš€ â“ğŸš€ğŸš€

Add to this the development-specific complexity (programming is hard, the technos evolve very quickly, it is impossible to know everything...), and all the ingredients are combined to develop a strong well-typed impostor syndrome.

body.text:
Imposter syndrome is a very common problem among developers.

The thing is : people rarely dare to speak up about it  ğŸ˜¶


But discussing it with other devs is an essential first step to:
body.list:
• Realise that you are not the only one struggling  ğŸš£ğŸ¼
  • Improve your technical level on sounder basis  ğŸ’ª
  • Launch a movement of detox all together  ğŸŒ± ğŸµ from an environment that can sometimes be toxic  ğŸ¤¢ â˜¢ï¸

body.link1Description: Collaborative collection of toxic situations in the development field
body.link2Description: Come and discuss your problems with others on our

microExperiences.description:
Florilege of everyday situations that you should never have to experiment in the world of the dev.

You have a life short experience to share? Do not hesitate, we will publish it anonymously or under an alias.

microExperience.label: You have a life short experience to share? We will be delighted to read it and publish it.

ourChat.title: Our Slack
ourChat.descriptionAfterLink: To allow the devs to speak from the heart about the problems they can encounter in tech.

rules.intro: For the well-being of all, we ask you to follow two main principles:
rules.list:
• ğŸ˜  Use a Pseudo

    Let us leave aside real names, workplaces and business names - Let's go back the swag of theInternet at the beginning of the 2000s and freed the voices.

  • ğŸ¤—  N ' never forgets inclusion and respect

    No racism, validism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, body shaming and any other -   isms, -   ing , and -   phobias that could make anyone uncomfortable. It requires a lot of energy and courage to speak, even anonymously in a remote corner of the Internet, so we will be intransigent on the issue.
